issues.description: The problem statement (UML and task description) specifies getTotalNumberOfStudents() should return an int (see UML: +getTotalNumberOfStudents(): int). The solution implementation instead defines getTotalNumberOfStudents() to return a custom StudentCount type and introduces a StudentCount class. This creates a return-type mismatch and an extra type not present in the problem statement or template. Students following the exercise (or the UML/tests) will implement getTotalNumberOfStudents() to return an int and may be confused by the solution using StudentCount; tests or autograder expecting an int would be incompatible with the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the return type consistent with the problem specification. Either (A) change the solution to have getTotalNumberOfStudents() return an int (e.g., return numberOfInscribedStudents + numberOfGuestStudents) and remove the StudentCount class, updating dependent methods (getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents, getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor) to use the int; or (B) update the problem statement and template to document and include the StudentCount type and specify that getTotalNumberOfStudents() returns StudentCount. Option A is recommended to match the UML and avoid introducing an extra class that is not described in the exercise.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML) specifies getTotalNumberOfStudents(): int, but the solution implements getTotalNumberOfStudents() returning a StudentCount object and introduces a new StudentCount class. This creates a conceptual/identifier mismatch: students expect a primitive int total (as described in the exercise) but the solution exposes a named wrapper type (StudentCount) not mentioned anywhere in the problem or template. This divergence can confuse students about the expected return type and the 'total number of students' concept.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem UML by changing getTotalNumberOfStudents() to return an int (the total number of students) and remove or avoid introducing the StudentCount wrapper class. Update all call sites in the solution to use the int return value (e.g., getTotalNumberOfStudents() instead of getTotalNumberOfStudents().getValue()). Alternatively, if the wrapper type is intentional, update the problem statement/UML and the template to document and introduce the StudentCount class so students see the same API across artifacts.
